All Classes

Class Description
AI
Abstract class to implement some AI-related methods, currently only used for one type of pathfinding
Animation
Groups together some useful information about an animation belonging to a game object.
AnimationInformation
This class is used to package all relevant information about an object's animation(s) in order to send it to the static Animator class It is only used once for each object subclass, since the retrieved animation is stored in the Animator class' animation pool after creation
Animator
This class contains the set of all animations needed for the current instance of the game.
AttackNode
The AttackNode class extends the functionality of the ComboNode class to allow for the implementation of different attacks for the player.
AttackSpeed
This class implements a pickup which increases the player's attack speed for a given amount of time On being picked up it will no longer be rendered but will stay in the game world for the rest of it's duration after which it will be marked for removal
ComboGraph
The combo graph class implements a state machine to handle the different states the player/weapon can be at a certain point It consists of several interconnected nodes each representing a state with its respective attributes (duration, possible transitions,etc) The relevant information can then be accessed by the player and weapon objects in their respective update methods
ComboNode
This class implements a basic node class for the ComboGraph object.
DLLLoader
This class handles the loading of the required native files for the JOGL libraries
DodgeNode
The DodgeNode class extends the ComboNode class to allow the player to dodge While dodging the player is invulnerable to damage and can move through enemies and obstacles
Enemy
Basic enemy template, adds some useful variables and methods to the GameObject superclass.
EventListener
Implements the GLEventListener interface provided by the JOGL library, providing various methods required for OpenGL functionality.
GameLoop
The GameLoop class handles all actions performed by the game engine while the game is running.
GameLoop.STATES
Different states the program can be in.
GameObject
Abstract class that sets the groundwork for the vast majority of objects making up a game world (level).
GroundTile
Simple traversable ground tile with no animations (only a static image)
HitBox
The HitBox class hold information about the position/orientation of the weapon during attacks as well as whether it is dealing damage in a specific animation frame.
HUD
The HUD (Heads-Up Display) represents the in-game menu providing information to the player during gameplay.
IdleNode
This class implements an "idle" state in the ComboGraph, i.e.
ImageResource
This class holds information about an image.
KeyInput
The KeyInput class implements the KeyListener interface provided in the JOGL library.
Main  
MainMenu
The class implements the main menu of the game and represents the entry point of the application from the users's perspective.
MainMenu.STATES
The states the menu van be in.
Menu
The Menu class helps ease the creation of menus by grouping together all the given options in a menu and providing methods to update the current state of the menu and render it as a whole
MenuOption
This class holds the some information about a menu option such as the name, size and position of the option The functionality of the doAction() method is left to be defined by the user
MouseInput
The MouseInput class implements the MouseListener interface and handles all the mouse-related events that the rest of the engine needs.
NonSolidDecoration
A non-solid decorative game object.
Pickup
This class implements a simple pickup object.
Player
This class implements a playable character capable of interaction with the game world The player object is capable of moving around the game world and attacking enemies The control scheme is handled by the KeyListener class Attacks are implemented through the Weapon class
Player.ANIMATIONS
Animation enum to hold indices, no.
Point
Implements a 2D point that is used in pathfinding The coordinates point to the center of a tile
Projectile  
Renderer
Handles the creation of the game frame, the initialization of some related OpenGL objects and provides useful functions for rendering graphics onto the screen
ScoreCounter
The score counter element displays the current score the player has accumulated
SecurityBot
Implements a basic test enemy that tries to reach the player and attack them
SecurityBot.ANIMATIONS  
Shadow
A class to implement simple shadows for game objects.
SolidDecoration
Solid decorative game object.
SoundClip
This class provides the required functionality for using sounds and music.
StatBars
The StatBars element displays the current health and stamina of the player as colored bars whose lengths are directly proportional to said values.
Terrain
This class holds an array of Tile objects as well as information about the size of the playable area int the current world (level)
Tile
This abstract class implements a basic ground tile object, which make up the playable area.
TileData  
Trigger  
VoidTile
A tile with a high depth/low height and no texture, used for making empty spaces/holes in the playable area without having to deal with null tiles in the terrain.
Weapon
Weapon object used by the player during attacks.
Weapon.ANIMATIONS
Animation enumeration for easier handling of the large amount of animations.
World
The World class groups information about the various game objects currently present and active.
